Feature: Are there definite or specific articles?
Do indefinite nominals commonly have indefinite articles?
Are there prenominal articles?
Are there postnominal articles?
What is the order of numeral and noun in the NP?
What is the order of adnominal demonstrative and noun?
Can adnominal property words occur discontinuously?
Are nominal conjunction and comitative expressed by different elements?
Example:
sǝ:lte-e punekte-e
charcoal-and ash-and
‘charcoal and ash’
asi-muna nari
woman-POSS man
‘man with his wife'
sin-du gese
2SG-DAT together
‘with you’

Feature: Is there an inclusive/exclusive distinction?
Is there a gender distinction in independent 3rd person pronouns?
Is there a dual or unit augmented form (in addition to plural or augmented) for all person categories in the pronoun system?
Are there three or more distance contrasts in demonstratives?
Do demonstratives show an elevation distinction?
Do demonstratives show a visible-nonvisible distinction?
Are there demonstrative classifiers?
Is there nonphonological allomorphy of noun number markers?
Are there several nouns (more than three) which are suppletive for number?
Is there productive overt morphological singular marking on nouns?
Is there productive morphological dual marking on nouns?
Is there productive morphological plural marking on nouns?
Comment: restricted to animates, can only in rare cases be attached to inanimates
Example:
putte ‘child’
puril ‘children’

Feature: Is there an associative plural marker for nouns?
Is there a productive morphological pattern for deriving an action/state noun from a verb?
Is there a productive morphological pattern for deriving an agent noun from a verb?
Is there a productive morphological pattern for deriving an object noun from a verb?
Is there a noun class/gender system where sex is a factor in class assignment?
Is there a noun class/gender system where shape is a factor in class assignment?
Is there a noun class/gender system where animacy is a factor in class assignment?
Is there a noun class/gender system where plant status is a factor in class assignment?
Are there numeral classifiers?
Are there possessive classifiers?
Is the adnominal possessive construction different for alienable and inalienable nouns?
Comment: “To such inalienable category belong the nouns meaning the parts of human body, relatives, clothing, utensils, and domestic animals etc“
Example:
ulise-bi
flesh-1SG
‘my flesh’
ulise-ŋu-bi
flesh-ALIEN-1SG
‘my meat’

Feature: What is the pragmatically unmarked order of adnominal possessor noun and possessed noun?
Example:
sin-i suŋdatta-ŋu-si
2SG-GEN fish-ALIEN-2SG
‘your fish’

Feature: Do core adjectives (defined semantically as property concepts such as value, shape, age, dimension) act like verbs in predicative position?
Example:
jedu namauli bič-či
here warm be-PST
‘It was warm here.’

Feature: Do core adjectives (defined semantically as property concepts; value, shape, age, dimension) used attributively require the same morphological treatment as verbs?
Example:
aja ula:
good reindeer
‘a good reindeer’

Are there morphological cases for pronominal core arguments (i.e. S/A/P)?

mim-bə:
1SG.OBL-ACC

Feature: Are there morphological cases for oblique non-pronominal NPs (i.e. not S/A/P)?
Are there morphological cases for oblique independent personal pronouns (i.e. not S/A/P)?
Comment: the same cases as for nouns

Feature: Are there prepositions?
Are there postpositions?
Example:
osto:li ojo-du-ni bičixe bi:-ni
table surface-DAT-3SG book be[PRS]-3SG
‘There is a book on the table.’

Is there overt morphological marking on the verb dedicated to future tense?

Is there an instrumental applicative marker on the verb (including indexing)?

Is there a phonologically bound reciprocal marker on the verb?

Feature: Are there serial verb constructions?

Can aspect be marked by an inflecting word ("auxiliary verb")?
Can tense be marked by an inflecting word ("auxiliary verb")?

table surface-DAT-3SG book be[PRS]-3SG

Example:
osto:li ojo-du-ni bičixe bi:-ni
table surface-DAT-3SG book be[PRS]-3SG

Feature: Is there a notably small number, i.e. about 100 or less, of verb roots in the language?

Is a pragmatically unmarked constituent order verb-medial for transitive clauses?

child be-CONJ here come-PST-1SG

Feature: Is the order of core argument (i.e. S/A/P) constituents fixed?

Comment: if the pronominal subject is omitted

Feature: Is there a difference between imperative (prohibitive) and declarative negation constructions?
Example:
tari nari e-si-ni ŋenne:
that man NEG-PRS.PTCP-3SG go.PTCP
‘That man doesn't go.’
ejjǝ: ŋenne:
NEG.IMP go.PTCP
‘Don’t go!’

Feature: Is verbal predication marked by the same negator as all of the following types of predication: locational, existential and nominal?
Example:

that man NEG-PRS.PTCP-3SG go.PTCP
‘That man doesn't go.’
bi: uilta e-si-wi bǝ:
1SG Uilta NEG-PRS-1SG be.PTCP
‘I am not an Uilta.’

2SG money-ALIEN-POSS NEG-2SG

Feature: Is there a morpho-syntactic distinction between predicates expressing controlled versus uncontrolled events or states?

Example:
bi: ča: nari-du pa:c-čo:č-čim-bi 1SG that man-DAT hit-CAUS-PST-1SG
